data.title: No. 13 Duke Rowing Travels to Oak Ridge Cardinal Invitational
data.meta_description: DURHAM – No. 13 Duke rowing travels to Oak Ridge, Tenn., to compete in the 12th annual Oak Ridge Cardinal Invitational on Melton Hill Lake.
data.text:
DURHAM – No. 13 Duke rowing travels to Oak Ridge, Tenn., to compete in the 12th annual Oak Ridge Cardinal Invitational on Melton Hill Lake this weekend.

The Blue Devils will compete in 15 races over the two-day event, as part of a 10-team field featuring host Louisville, Alabama, Clemson, No. 16 Indiana, Navy, North Carolina, Notre Dame, San Diego and Wisconsin.

HOW TO FOLLOW

Live results for the Oak Ridge Cardinal Invitational will be posted throughout the day on HereNow.

THE SCHEDULE

Saturday Morning Session

9:14 a.m. – Third Varsity Eight/Novice Eight

9:22 a.m. – Varsity Eight

9:30 a.m. – First Varsity Four

9:38 a.m. – Second Varsity Eight

9:46 a.m. – Second Varsity Four

Saturday Afternoon Session

3:02 p.m. – Third Varsity Eight/Novice Eight

3:10 p.m. – Varsity Eight

3:18 p.m. – First Varsity Four

3:26 p.m. – Second Varsity Eight

3:34 p.m. – Second Varsity Four

Sunday Morning Session

8:34 a.m – Third Varsity Eight/Novice Eight

8:42 a.m. – Varsity Eight

8:50 a.m. – First Varsity Four

8:58 a.m. – Second Varsity Eight

9:06 a.m. – Second Varsity Four

ABOUT THE BLUE DEVILS

Head coach Megan Cooke Carcagno enters her ninth season at the helm of the program and returns 25 letterwinners from last year's team, including 16 that competed in the 2023 NCAA Championships.

At the NCAA Championships last season, the Varsity Eight and Second Varsity Eight boats advanced to the C Finals while the Varsity Four secured a spot in the Petite Final.

As a team, Duke saw its best finish in program history, placing 14th overall with 56 points in the championship.

The Blue Devils also welcomed 16 newcomers in eight freshman, one sophomore and seven graduate transfers.

Graduate student Morgan Linsley, senior Brenna Morley and junior Mollie Nicol will serve as team captains for the 2024 campaign. The Blue Devil trio were all selected to serve as captains for the first time in their careers.

KEY RETURNERS

Audrey Kline – Kline coxed the Blue Devils' Second Varsity Eight in eight regattas during her sophomore season. The Seattle, Wash., native guided Duke's 2V8+ to a silver medal at the ACC Championships and a first-place finish in the C Final race at the NCAA Championships after a tight race with the crew from No. 15 Rutgers.

Kathryn Nash - Nash has been a consistent member of Duke's Varsity Eight lineup over the last two seasons. The Chattanooga, Tenn., native has competed in 21 regattas as a Blue Devil, including three appearances at the NCAA Championships. She was also named to the inaugural Preseason ACC Rowing Watch List in February.

Brenna Morley – Morley was voted one of three team captains heading into her senior season. She is coming off her third appearance at the NCAA Championships in Duke's Varsity Eight that placed third in the C Final race. She also stroked the Championship 4+ boat to a seventh-place finish at the 58th Head of the Charles Regatta in Cambridge, Mass., earlier this fall.

Noelle Fuchs – Fuchs saw action in all eight regattas during her sophomore season, primarily in Duke's Second Varsity Eight boat. She was part of the 2V8+ crew that earned a silver medal at the ACC Championships and a first-place finish in C Final race at the NCAA Championships.

NOTEABLE NEWCOMERS

Ellen Ulitsky - Ulitsky joins the Blue Devils after graduating from UCLA last year. Ellen, along with twin sister Irene, was a key member of the Bruins' Varsity Eight lineup for the 2022-23 season. The duo helped UCLA to a first-place finish at the Big Ten Invitational and a three-race sweep over Loyola Marymount. She was also selected to represent the United States at the World Rowing Championships in Varese, Italy, as part of the quadruple sculls boat that placed sixth overall.

Irene Ulitsky – Ulitsky joins the Blue Devils after graduating from UCLA last year. Irene, along with twin sister Ellen, was a key member of the Bruins' Varsity Eight lineup for the 2022-23 season. The duo helped UCLA to a first-place finish at the Big Ten Invitational and a three-race sweep over Loyola Marymount.

Elizabeth May - May comes to Durham after graduating from the University of Notre Dame in May. The Melrose, Mass., native competed as a member of the Varsity Eight and Second Varsity Eight boats for the Irish. During her junior year, May sat in the bow seat of the Varsity Eight lineup that earned a bronze medal at the Dale England Cup and finished third in the Petite Final of the 2022 ACC Championship in Clemson, S.C.

Florine Lijesen – Lijesen competed as a key part of her high school's Varsity 4+ lineup that earned a strong third-place finish at the 2021 Midwest Youth Championship and a 10th-place finish at the Head of the Charles Regatta in 2022. Lijesen and her teammate, Kathryn Serra, also earned a gold medal at the 2023 Florida Scholastic Rowing Association Sculling Championships in Sarasota, Fla.

To stay up to date with Blue Devils rowing, follow the team on Twitter, Instagram and Facebook by searching "DukeROW"

Duke Centennial

In 2024, Duke celebrates its Centennial, marking one hundred years since Trinity College became Duke University. Duke will use this historic milestone to deepen the understanding of its history, inspire pride and strengthen bonds and partnerships, and prepare for a second century of continued excellence and impactful leadership. To learn more, please visit 100.duke.edu

#GoDuke
